TopicTitle: Moar Science experiments! Really, are there more?

Articles.Content:
Hi

As stated I want to find mods who add more science instruments into the game. I like building satellites and rover and attach new parts to them and then read the science log etc.

Long story short, what i got already:

**Science mods so far**  **(****tested with 0.9****)**:

- [DMagic Orbital Science](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php?t=64972)

- [LTech](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/53813-0-24-0-L-Tech-Scientific-Industries-V2-20) (Stripped for science parts only ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

- [ScanSat](https://github.com/S-C-A-N/SCANsat/releases)

- [Nehemiah Engineering](https://kerbalstuff.com/mod/629/Nehemiah%20Engineering%20Research%20Program) (all of them, includes Orbital Science)

- [Solar science](https://kerbalstuff.com/mod/611/Solar%20Science)

- [Kdex](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/54656-0-23-5-KDEX-Kerbal-Dust-Experiment-v1-02)

- [Tarsier Space Technology](https://kerbalstuff.com/mod/608/Tarsier%20Space%20Technology%20with%20Galaxies)

- [Station science](http://Station)

- [PEST](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/112259-P-E-S-T-Probe-Expansion-and-Science-Things) (removed some probe cores as i got enough)

- [Karbonite](https://bobpalmer.github.io/UmbraSpaceIndustries/)/K+ Stuff from Umbrella Space

- [Banana for Scale](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/89570-Banana-for-Scale-Analyse-bananas-in-space!)

- [Nano Kube](https://kerbalstuff.com/mod/579/NanoKube:%20Ultra-Small%20Probes)

- [Lionhead Rover pack](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/12106-0-25-Lionhead-Aerospace-Inc-Icarus-v0-4-updated) (for the robotic arm ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) )

#Added from various posts beneath, for more easier find (many Thanks for your help guys im impressed from the helfulness in this forum):

- [Impact](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/114087-0-90-Impact%21-impact-science-an-contracts-v1-0-0-27-mar-15) mod (made the parts scaleable)

- [Bargain Parts](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/58639-0-24-Bargain-Rocket-Parts-v1-1-Bust-out-the-duct-tape-we-re-going-to-space%21?highlight=pizza) (striped only for 4 cool science projects ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) )

- [Fuel Science](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/67359) (not for me as it adds again even more space labs with nearly the same experiments as station science)

- [Munar Surface Experiment Package](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/86247-0-90-Munar-Surfaces-Experiment-package-%28Phase-3-update-now-available!%29) (Perfect!)

- [Real Simple Science](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/77555) (another GREAT mod to monitor the viatal signs of your kerbals) **NOT WORKING IN 0.90**

- [Torus](http://kerbal.curseforge.com/ksp-mods/221761-stanford-torus-0-6-1?cookieTest=1) (adds 4 new experiments)

My goal is to get new existing science, so please don't report mods with another thermometer etc as they will not yield more science. Or make one :-)

Also if possible not more mods with science labs as i already got a few and its gets crowded in space..... Simple parts preferred.

PS: You can see me and my mun rover adventures here: [MKerb Space Agency](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/114195-MKerb-Mun-Rover-MR1) (soon with more science parts ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

What I would like/Ideas:

- Karbonite Research tool: splits karbonite in its components and you get science from it, gets different science when karbonite percentage differs more than 0,5 percent, so its not just one experiment. To gain the most science karbonite should be mined first and then transfered to the science tool, but crust mining is also ok for lower science value.

- Storm research: Research the weather storms from Orbit of Kerbin or Duna or any other atmospheric planet. (Is this possible ?)

- Test animal exposure to other atmospheres than Kerbin (smaller version of the station science project)

-- Cruel version: expose animals to no athomsphere

-- Expose animals to mun dust, duna dust etc... Do they eat it ?

- Mix Rocketfuel and monopropellant with different binome material ans see what happens: gives science but could also explode. (challange to put this on a rover whithout making it explode....)

- Melt material: Melt surface material and see how it behaves, needs a loot of energy :-) But still suitable for rovers and probes, could also need a scoop arm as a part ?

- Radioactive research: Make Karbonite radioactive and see what happens with that mysterious material.

- Ion research: detect the ion field in space on planets etc...

- Deep Core Drill, drill really deep into the surface of planets, asteroids etc, needs a lot of energy and is a big part like the soil moisture sensor :-)

Thanks a whole lot for feedback!

Manux

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-08T17:52:43Z" title="04/08/2015 05:52  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 8, 2015</time> by ManuxKerb**
  
new science
Have you got the [Impact](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/114087-0-90-Impact!-impact-science-an-contracts-v1-0-0-27-mar-15) mod? It adds in contracts and new science parts.

I think you meant Dmagic by Dmatic? Just asking as I was going to suggest that.

Also, you should get CSS (community sourced science), makes a huge number of unique science reports.

Melt surface material: Isn't that what the surface ablation laser instrument from Dmagics science stuff does?

Ion research: The magnetometer and RPWS antenna (both from Dmagic) fill that role, unless you're thinking of a specific type of experiment.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-29T19:07:40Z" title="03/29/2015 07:07  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 29, 2015</time> by smjjames**
Thanks i already got CSS and just grabed the Impact mod :-) Any more suggestions ?

While B9 doesn't add new science stuff, it does have a part which combines the functions of all of the stock science experiments so that they're available in a single part, which is nice and convenient. Theres also a radial version of the atmospheric science part.

Theres also the cactus telescope thing if you want to look into that one.

I've been finding a few more mods, like [Bargain Parts](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/58639-0-24-Bargain-Rocket-Parts-v1-1-Bust-out-the-duct-tape-we-re-going-to-space!?highlight=pizza).

Will be finding more if you need some extra (i.e. you can go to the Mun and Minmus to complete the entire tech tree, and some contracts give you science, which also means that you can download a ton of contract packs, like ones that make SCANsat useful for your career).

--edit--

I found a re-skin of the Mystery goo experiment, but you could possibly re-modify the science defs (It's [Papa Kerbalini's Pizza!](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92832-Papa-Kerballini-s-Pizza-A-Pizza-Science-Experiment-in-SPACE!?highlight=pizza)).

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-29T20:40:43Z" title="03/29/2015 08:40  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 29, 2015</time> by Astrofox**
  
Found something more

There's two addon packs for Station Science:

[Fuel Science](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/67359)

[Orbital Material Science](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/81578)

Thanks i look into the [Bargain Parts](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/58639-0-24-Bargain-Rocket-Parts-v1-1-Bust-out-the-duct-tape-we-re-going-to-space%21?highlight=pizza) at the moment :-) I already got Orbital Material Science and fuel science is just well basically the same experiments from station science and i dont want to get too much labs in my orbit. But thanks for the suggestion :-)

The Pizza mod seems to be just a reskin..

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-29T21:32:05Z" title="03/29/2015 09:32  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 29, 2015</time> by ManuxKerb**

> 
> Munar Surface Experiment Package [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/86247-0-90-Munar-Surfaces-Experiment-package-%28Phase-3-update-now-available!%29](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/86247-0-90-Munar-Surfaces-Experiment-package-%28Phase-3-update-now-available!%29)

This looks AWESOME! I think i need a bigger rover :-)

Hi

I just found a nice robotic Arm in the [Lionhead Rover pack](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/12106-0-25-Lionhead-Aerospace-Inc-Icarus-v0-4-updated) :-) It does Bio-analysis :-)!!!

You could try [DMagic Orbital Science](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/64972-0-90-DMagic-Orbital-Science-New-Science-Parts-V0-9-2-%282-26-15%29) or [Tarsier space tech](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/62941-v0-24-Tarsier-Space-Technology-%28v4-5c-Now-with-GALAXIES!!!%29).

Wooo, what a nice list of science mods!

Also, if you're searching for the nice stuff 

[RealSimpleScience](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/77555)

 This would be pretty nice mod, I guess. However I dont know if it runs on 0.90.

> Also, if you're searching for the nice stuff

>

Unfotunatelly [RealSimpleScience](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/77555) seems not to work with 0.9 when i click on it no science panel pops up :-(
